basic.floral_language:
Fenestraria aurantiaca
Floriography: guileless, cute, bright
Has a unique and exquisite form with clustered fleshy club-like leaves, bigger on the top, fresh and juicy, like paw pads of small animals, in a cool season with abundant sunlight, leaves turn slight red brown. 
Likes sunny places, has a summer dormant period, place under scattered light. Flowers sometimes, orange-yellow color.
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, orange flowers
basic.color: Leaf color green, when sunny turning to red brown

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes light, dormant in summer under high temperatures, put in places with scattered light
maintenance.watering: Resistant to drought, water thoroughly when soil is dry, stop watering in summer
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove dead and rotten part timely
